name: Audio Bird
description:
AudioBird is an audio-only game, where the player controls a perpetually problematic pitch slider.

The player must try to match the left tone to the right tone to score points.

To do match the tones, the player can control the left note's pitch by tapping the spacebar.

By tapping the spacebar, you will be pushing the pitch slider up, but because the slider is so loose and broken,

if you fail to tap the spacebar for a period of time the pitch will begin to drop.

Besides the two pitches you will be able to hear two more sounds. One is a percussive beat, that speeds up until

the point that you will be graded on the two notes. If they are equal, you will gain a point. Right after, a new note will spawn, and the game will continue.

The second sound that you can hear is white noise, conveying to you at what point your pitch slider is within a note. When the white noise is high pitched, you are at the higher end of the note, meaning any more space-bar clicking will push you over the cutoff point and into the next note. When it is lower, you are at the low end.
